physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Dysarthric speech, left-sided dysmetria on finger-nose-finger testing, slightly unsteady tandem gait. Remainder of examination was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Fatigue and cold intolerance worsened; joint pains recurred after discontinuation of prednisone.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 132/80 mm Hg, Pulse: 80 beats per minute, Respiratory rate: 16 per minute
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mental status was normal. Visual fields full to confrontation; acuity 20/30 bilaterally. First cranial nerve dysfunction was noted as the left pupil was minimally enlarged with subtle ptosis of the left lid. Strength in arms and legs was normal. The patient noted imbalance during rapid alternating movements.
Weight gain, acne, and development of hypertension.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Changes in vital signs noted, with blood pressure increasing.
